Improvements.Improvement: Use string formatting for better readability
Improvements.Change_Diff:
- System.out.println("Leaderboard scores downloaded: handle=" + leaderboard.toString() + ", entries="+ entries.toString()+ ", count="+ numEntries);
+ System.out.println(String.format("Leaderboard scores downloaded: handle=%s, entries=%s, count=%d", leaderboard, entries, numEntries));
Improvements.Description: The System.out.println statements have a lot of concatenation which makes the code harder to read. Using String.format() can make this easier to read and understand.

Improvements.Improvement: Use StringBuilder for multiple System.out.println statements
Improvements.Description: Using StringBuilder for multiple System.out.println statements can improve performance, especially when the number of concatenations is large.
